content.title: Integrated Horticulture Development
content.details: Horticulture sector in Assam deals with various crops and activities including fruits, vegetables, spices, floriculture, and more. The department encourages the expansion of high-value commercial crops through various schemes.
benefits: Improve productivity through quality germplasm and water use efficiency
Horticulture Subsidy for Fruits and Vegetables
eligibility: 2 years' post qualification experience preferably in irrigation sector
Minimum 55% marks or 5.5/10 CGPA or equivalent marks at graduate/diploma level
content.application_process: Online and Offline applications are accepted. Applications can be submitted at the District Agriculture office through the local Agriculture Development Officer.
documents_required: 2 years' post qualification experience preferably in irrigation sector
Minimum 55% marks or 5.5/10 CGPA or equivalent marks at graduate/diploma level

faqs.question: What is the status of horticulture in Assam?
faqs.answer: The Horticultural Growth rate in Assam contributes significantly to the overall growth of Agriculture in the state.

faqs.question: What is the mission of integrated development of horticulture?
faqs.answer: MIDH is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme for the holistic growth of the horticulture sector covering various crops.

faqs.question: What is the requirement for horticulture?
faqs.answer: Candidates must complete 10+2 in Science with Biology as a compulsory subject to be eligible for the BSc Horticulture Science course.

faqs.question: Which ministry does horticulture come under?
faqs.answer: Horticulture comes under the Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare.

faqs.question: When was Mission for Integrated Development of horticulture established?
faqs.answer: MIDH was implemented from 2014-15 for holistic development of horticulture in the country.
